page.title: 01CWMBRAN - GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Our area of study covers the heart of the New Town of Cwmbran, comprising the modern shopping centre and the surrounding residential areas. The New Town encompasses the old villages of Pontnewydd and Cwmbran, and the former, still a small, lively shopping centre, is in close proximity to both schools. The main road and rail links and the now disused canal run North-South through the centre of the area following closely the course of the Afon Lwyd river and serve a spine of engineering works. A large industrial estate of unit engineering works and 'hi-tech' developments lies to the South West occupying the site of a former colliery and foundry. The Western edge of the area borders the lower slopes of Mynydd Maen while to the North and East is land mainly used for mixed farming.
